question:
A merchant wants to make a choice of purchase between 2 purchase plans: 
    jewelry worth $8000 or electronic gadgets worth $8000. 
    His financial advisor speculates that the jewelry market will go up 2.7% 
    while the electronic gadgets market will rise 3.8% within the same month. 
    If the merchant is looking to maximize profit at the end of this month by making a choice, how much profit would this be?
answer:
If he purchases jewelry, he will make a profit of 2.7% which is $8000*(2.7/100) = $<<8000*(2.7/100)=216>>216.
    If he purchases electronic gadgets, he will make a profit of 3.8% which is $8000*(3.8/100) = $<<8000*(3.8/100)=304>>304.
    If he wants to maximize profit, since $304 > $216, 
    he will choose to purchase electronic gadgets, thereby making a profit of $<<304=304>>304.
    #### 304
